isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT - 1992 - 1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING - ACCELERATOR PEDAL APS/IVS

svcprocinfo.para: The following five tests (Test A through E) check the accelerator position sensor (APS), the idle validation switch (IVS) and the related International cab and engine harness CELECT circuits connected to the ECM.

The tests should be performed if a Cummins fault code indicates a problem in the circuits or if the Compulink TM or Pro-Link DDR indicates that the APS/IVS is not working properly while monitoring switches. If Compulink TM detects a fault with the IVS circuits while monitoring switches, the display would show Idle Validation Switch = Fault. If a fault is present while monitoring Percent Of Throttle, the percent displayed does not indicate actual throttle position. (For the operational discussion of the APS and IVS, refer to paragraph Accelerator Pedal Assembly)

note.para: Tests A through E must be performed in sequence.

svcsubproc.title: TEST A - ACCELERATOR POSITION SENSOR (APS)
svcsubproc.para: This test checks the APS circuits in the accelerator pedal assembly.

svcsubproc.title: TEST B - IDLE VALIDATION SWITCH (IVS)
svcsubproc.para: This test checks the IVS circuits in the accelerator pedal assembly.

svcsubproc.title: TEST C - ACCELERATOR PEDAL (APS/IVS) "SHORT AND OPEN CIRCUIT"
svcsubproc.para: This test checks the cab and engine harness APS/IVS circuits for opens, shorts to ground, shorts to "hot" circuits and shorts to other circuits in the harness.

svcsubproc.title: TEST D - ACCELERATOR POSITION SENSOR (APS) CIRCUIT
svcsubproc.para: This test checks the individual APS circuits (cab and engine harness) for correct resistance while connected to the accelerator pedal assembly.

svcsubproc.title: TEST E - IDLE VALIDATION SWITCH (IVS) CIRCUIT
svcsubproc.para: This test checks the individual IVS circuits (cab and engine harness) for correct resistance while connected to the accelerator pedal assembly.

svcsubproc.title: ACCELERATOR/ECM CALIBRATION
svcsubproc.para: The electronic accelerator pedal assembly and the ECM must be calibrated when:

item.para: The pedal assembly is initially installed.
The accelerator pedal is disconnected (at any point in the circuitry) and the key switch is placed in the ON position.

svcsubproc.para: To recalibrate the accelerator pedal and ECM:

item.para: The vehicle key must be in the ON position.
Depress the accelerator pedal slowly through the complete range of movement, then release. Slowly depress and release, three times in this manner. This completes the calibration process.
